title: BuildCraft Construction public site alignment to buildcraft.co.in reference

requirements.summary: Restructure the single-page public site navigation and section order/anchors to closely match the buildcraft.co.in reference while keeping section-scroll UX.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary navigation links/labels and section anchors match the reference site’s structure as closely as possible within the current app architecture
All header and footer links scroll to the correct on-page sections without broken anchors
No placeholder/ocean-themed content remains visible anywhere on the public site

file_operations.description: Update header IA to match the reference: revise nav labels and anchor targets to the existing section IDs (home/about/services/projects/why-choose-us/testimonials/contact), remove public-facing Sign In from primary nav, and remove the non-reference CountriesBar strip. Use existing shadcn-ui Button for mobile toggle; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure mobile navigation renders the updated header nav items and highlights the active section consistently, with all links scrolling to valid on-page anchors (no broken hash targets).

Align footer quick links to the same section IDs used on the page (fix current About Us mapping to #about, add Why Choose Us and Testimonials if present in the reference IA), and ensure footer links scroll to the correct sections.
Confirm the main single-page section composition and ordering matches the reference as closely as feasible (and includes sections present in the navigation) without introducing new top-level routes.

requirements.summary: Update global Tailwind/stylesheet styling to a construction/industrial visual system consistent across sections, cards, and CTAs without editing immutable UI component sources.
acceptanceCriteria: Site uses a coherent construction-themed visual system consistently across header, hero, section blocks, cards, and CTAs
All pages/sections remain readable with sufficient contrast and responsive behavior from mobile to desktop
No edits are made to any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT

file_operations.description: Refine the construction/industrial theme tokens and shared utility classes (typography scale, spacing, card styling, button/CTA consistency via composition, and section background treatments) to visually align with the reference site while preserving responsive readability.

Adjust Tailwind theme extensions as needed to support the updated construction visual system (e.g., typography/font families, radii, shadows, and color usage via CSS variables) without modifying immutable shadcn/ui component sources. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align hero layout composition (spacing, overlay readability, CTA grouping) to the reference while keeping existing section-scroll behavior and using existing shadcn-ui Button variants. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Replace all public marketing copy with BuildCraft content aligned to buildcraft.co.in and keep all displayed text in English using the centralized site content module.
acceptanceCriteria: All displayed company/marketing content matches the reference site’s messaging (adapted into clear English where needed)
Content is stored/managed via the existing structured content source (site content module) rather than being hard-coded across many components
No truncated or cut-off strings appear in any section (hero, about, services, projects, testimonials, contact)

file_operations.description: Update structured marketing content to match the reference (company name/tagline/description, hero text, about copy, services list, projects, why-choose-us items, testimonials, and contact copy) in English, and extend the schema to cover currently hard-coded UI strings (section headings, value cards, form headings, success/error copy) to avoid scattering text across components.
Remove hard-coded About/values/team strings and render all About section user-facing text from siteContent to ensure consistency and easier updates.
Ensure services section titles/descriptions are entirely driven by siteContent and match the reference messaging (English), without truncation.
Ensure projects section titles/descriptions and any supporting labels are driven by siteContent and match the reference messaging (English).
Ensure why-choose-us section heading/items are driven by siteContent and match the reference messaging (English).
Ensure testimonials section heading/items are driven by siteContent and match the reference messaging (English) without clipped quotes/roles.
Ensure contact section headings and contact info labels/copy are driven by siteContent and match the reference (English).

Move remaining hard-coded form UI strings (titles, inline validation messages, submit/loading labels, success headings, and error banners) into siteContent so all user-facing copy is centralized and consistent. Use existing shadcn-ui form controls (Input/Textarea/Select/Button); verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Update navigation labels to match the reference site’s wording and ensure the visible company name/text reflects updated siteContent.
Update footer copy (company description, link labels, contact labels) to match the reference site messaging in English and pull from siteContent where applicable.

requirements.summary: Wire the specified generated BuildCraft logos and construction imagery across header, footer, sections, and SEO/social so all images load from frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: Header and footer render the horizontal logo; favicon/small usage renders the icon logo; social sharing metadata uses the social banner image
Hero/background and section images render without broken links and do not rely on video assets
All image references are served as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated (not via backend endpoints)

file_operations.description: Confirm BRAND_ASSETS points to the required generated assets and is used as the single source of truth: frontend/public/assets/generated/buildcraft-logo-horizontal.dim_512x128.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/buildcraft-logo-icon.dim_256x256.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/buildcraft-logo-social.dim_512x256.png.
Ensure the header logo uses BRAND_ASSETS.logoHorizontal and does not reference any legacy/ocean assets.
Ensure the footer logo/download uses BRAND_ASSETS.logoHorizontal and does not reference any legacy/ocean assets.
Ensure hero background image uses the required generated asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/construction-hero-bg.dim_2400x1350.jpg and loads reliably as a static asset.
Ensure the projects section texture uses frontend/public/assets/generated/construction-section-texture.dim_2400x1200.png and loads reliably as a static asset.
Ensure the About section image uses frontend/public/assets/generated/construction-about-team.dim_1600x900.jpg and loads reliably as a static asset.
Ensure the Contact section supporting image uses frontend/public/assets/generated/construction-contact-support.dim_1600x900.jpg and loads reliably as a static asset.

Update favicon/icon links and social image meta tags to use the required generated assets (icon: frontend/public/assets/generated/buildcraft-logo-icon.dim_256x256.png; social: frontend/public/assets/generated/buildcraft-logo-social.dim_512x256.png), removing any ocean/legacy asset references.
Verify the preloader uses BRAND_ASSETS for the required logos and that any console logging remains non-blocking and does not reference legacy/ocean branding.

requirements.summary: Update SEO metadata (title/description/OG/Twitter) to BuildCraft branding while preserving verification files, robots.txt, sitemap.xml, and manifest functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: Page title and meta description reflect BuildCraft construction branding aligned to the reference site
OG/Twitter/social image points to the generated social banner asset
Existing verification files in frontend/public remain present and unchanged

file_operations.description: Replace ocean-themed title/description/author/keywords and OG/Twitter tags with BuildCraft construction branding aligned to the reference, and set OG/Twitter image to frontend/public/assets/generated/buildcraft-logo-social.dim_512x256.png while leaving Google verification meta tags intact.

Update manifest name/short_name/theme_color to BuildCraft construction branding, and update icons to use BuildCraft icon asset where feasible (frontend/public/assets/generated/buildcraft-logo-icon.dim_256x256.png) while preserving manifest functionality.
Align JSON-LD structured data to BuildCraft branding and contact details from siteContent, and ensure the logo URL references BRAND_ASSETS.logoSocial.
Verify runtime canonical/OG/Twitter URL updates remain compatible with updated BuildCraft metadata (no hard-coded legacy domain assumptions).

requirements.summary: Keep the contact/inquiry form submission fully functional with validation and clear English success/error states, submitting all required fields to the backend actor.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the contact form successfully persists an inquiry in the backend with all fields populated
Validation errors are shown inline for missing/invalid fields (name/email/phone/service/message)
On success, the confirmation state/message displays in English and the form resets

file_operations.description: Ensure the form still submits name/email/phone/service/message through the existing useSubmitInquiry mutation, shows inline validation errors for all required fields, and provides clear English success/error UI states. Use existing shadcn-ui Input/Textarea/Select/Button components; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure contact form placeholders, service type labels, validation copy, success message, and any error/help text are present in English and aligned with the reference. Ensure serviceTypes values match the backend ServiceType enum strings.

Harden the inquiry submission mutation UX by ensuring frontend-visible errors are meaningful (e.g., actor unavailable vs. submit failure) while keeping the existing backend call path intact (via core-infrastructure useActor).
Ensure the Contact section presents the form with reference-aligned headings and that the form remains accessible and usable across responsive breakpoints.
